metadata.title: CVE-2022-39842 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
** DISPUTED ** An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.19. Inpxa3xx_gcu_write in drivers/video/fbdev/pxa3xx-gcu.c, the count parameterhas a type conflict of size_t versus int, causing an integer overflow andbypassing the size check. After that, because it is used as the thirdargument to copy_from_user(), a heap overflow may occur. NOTE: the originaldiscoverer disputes that the overflow can actually happen.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-39842` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1162-azure - 4.15.0-1162.177~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
